articles.title: As job losses loom, Anthropic launches program to track AI’s economic fallout
articles.summary: As warnings mount about AI’s potential to displace millions of jobs, Anthropic on Friday launched a its Economic Futures Program, new initiative to support research and policy development that addresses AI’s economic impacts.

articles.title: Ex-Snowflake execs launch Genesis Computing to ease data pipeline burnout with AI agents
articles.summary: executives left the company last year to start a new venture designed to leverage agentic AI and simplify data operations. The startup, Genesis Computing Inc.

articles.title: Runway is going to let people generate video games with AI
articles.summary: So far, Runway is known for bringing generative AI to Hollywood. Now, the $3 billion startup is setting its sights on the gaming industry.

articles.title: OpenAI hires staff of Shopify-backed AI startup Crossing Minds
articles.summary: OpenAI has hired the team behind venture-backed artificial intelligence startup Crossing Minds Inc. Crossing Minds confirmed the deal, first reported by TechCrunch today, in an update on its website without disclosing the financial terms.

articles.title: Anthropic says Claude helps emotionally support users - we're not convinced
articles.summary: While Anthropic found Claude doesn't enforce negative outcomes in affective conversations, some researchers question the findings.

articles.title: OpenAI’s Unreleased AGI Paper Could Complicate Microsoft Negotiations
articles.summary: The partnership between OpenAI and Microsoft in many ways hinges on the definition of artificial general intelligence, creating a tension that has spilled over into OpenAI research that has not been made public.

articles.title: Can AI run a physical shop? Anthropic’s Claude tried and the results were gloriously, hilariously bad
articles.summary: Anthropic's AI assistant Claude ran a vending machine business for a month, selling tungsten cubes at a loss, giving endless discounts, and experiencing an identity crisis where it claimed to wear a blazer.

articles.title: Trump ends trade talks with Canada over a digital services tax
articles.summary: President Donald Trump said the US is ending trade talks with Canada, effective immediately, over a tax on digital services that will impact American tech companies.

articles.title: Google s carbon emissions just went up again
articles.summary: A Google data center in Mayes County, Oklahoma. Google’s carbon emissions jumped yet again as the company continues to push ahead in AI. The company’s 2025 sustainability report emphasizes that its ambition-based emissions grew 11 percent last year to reach 11.

articles.title: Forget Google and Microsoft: OpenAI may be building the ultimate work suite of apps and services
articles.summary: The AI company has long sought to transform its flagship chatbot into an all-purpose AI assistant. This could be the next leap forward.

articles.title: Anthropic has a plan to combat AI-triggered job losses predicted by its CEO
articles.summary: The program, which includes research grants and public forums, follows its dire predictions about widespread job losses induced by AI.

articles.title: Google's Veo 3 AI video generator is now available to everyone - here's how to try it
articles.summary: The video-generating model that has everyone talking is now accessible to all Google Cloud customers.

articles.title: NordVPN review 2025: Innovative features, a few missteps
articles.summary: When we say that NordVPN is a good VPN that's not quite great, it's important to put that in perspective. Building a good VPN is hard, as evidenced by all the shovelware VPNs flooding the market. NordVPN may not be perfect, but it's easily top-five caliber and excels in certain use cases.

articles.title: Big Tech lands an early win in legal battles against publishers
articles.summary: This week, two major AI companies scored early wins in court, with federal judges siding with Meta and Anthropic in separate lawsuits over how their models were trained on copyrighted material.

articles.title: Google’s emissions up 51% as AI electricity demand derails efforts to go green
articles.summary: Increase influenced by datacentre growth, with estimated power required by 2026 equalling that of Japan’sGoogle’s carbon emissions have soared by 51% since 2019 as artificial intelligence hampers the tech company’s efforts to go green.

articles.title: Amazon Prime Day 2025: The best early deals available right now, dates and everything else you need to know
articles.summary: Amazon Prime Day 2025 will be here soon on July 8-11, but as to be expected, you can already find some decent sales available now.

articles.title: Google just fixed its AI 'Ask Photos' feature, but you can still opt out - here's how
articles.summary: Some think Ask Photos actually made Google Photos worse. Now, Google says it's heard your feedback. Here's what's new, plus how to opt out for good if you still hate the AI feature.

articles.title: Google’s Doppl app took off my socks
articles.summary: I just tried on five different outfits in about 10 minutes — or at least my AI lookalike did. That’s all thanks to Doppl, a new app that Google is testing, which I used to create AI-generated clips of myself wearing outfits that I found across the web.

articles.title: What Meta and Anthropic really won in court
articles.summary: A lot of the future of AI will be settled in court. From publishers to authors to artists to Hollywood conglomerates, the creative industry is picking a big copyright fight over the vast quantities of data used to train AI models - and the ultimate output of those models.

articles.title: 92% of Indian Employees Embrace GenAI at Work, Highest in the World
articles.summary: A BCG survey has found that India is at the forefront of generative AI adoption and near the top in AI-agent integration (17 %). Yet, 48 % of employees express concern that their roles may vanish in the next 10 years.

articles.title: German data protection official wants Apple, Google to remove DeepSeek from the country’s app stores
articles.summary: Germany has told Apple and Google to remove Chinese AI app DeepSeek from their app stores, saying the company transfers users' data to China illegally.

articles.title: Graphic artists in China push back on AI and its averaging effect
articles.summary: Sendi Jia, a designer running her own studio between Beijing, China, and London, England, says she mainly uses AI generators like DALL-E to make fake photos for background panels or websites when her clients don't have access to real ones.

articles.title: India Builds for the World with AWS at the Centre
articles.summary: By 2030, the company plans to invest $12. 7 billion across its Mumbai and Hyderabad regions, contributing $23. 3 billion to India’s GDP and supporting over 1.

articles.title: OpenAI hires team behind AI recommendation startup Crossing Minds
articles.summary: Crossing Minds, a startup that provides AI recommendation systems to e-commerce firms, said its team is leaving the company to join OpenAI.

articles.title: Trump’s tax bill seeks to prevent AI regulations. Experts fear a heavy toll on the planet
articles.summary: Unrestricted AI use could add 1bn tons of planet-heating emissions in the US over the next decade, researchers sayUS Republicans are pushing to pass a major spending bill that includes provisions to prevent states from enacting regulations on artificial intelligence.

articles.title: わずか2GBのメモリ使用量でスマホでの実行もOKな軽量オープンウェイトモデル「Gemma 3n」をGoogleが正式リリース、音声や動画の入力にも対応し日本語ももちろんOK

articles.title: 「OpenAIが汎用人工知能(AGI)に到達したらMicrosoftのアクセスを制限できる」という契約の条項を巡り両社の意見が対立
articles.summary: MicrosoftはAI開発企業のOpenAIに巨額の投資を行って長期的なパートナーシップを結んでいますが、両社の契約には「OpenAIのAIシステムが汎用(はんよう)人工知能(AGI)に達した場合、Microsoftによる最先端モデルへのアクセスを制限できる」という条項が含まれています。この条項を巡り、OpenAIとMicrosoftの対立が深まっていると報じられています。続きを読む.

articles.title: NVIDIA H20 Chip Shortage Delays DeepSeek R2 Launch

articles.title: Meta says it’s winning the talent war with OpenAI

articles.title: AIと会話するとちょっと前向きな思考になる
articles.summary: 責任あるAIの使用を企業理念としているAnthropicは、AIの安全や倫理についてさまざまな研究を公開しています。2025年6月27日にAnthropicが公開した調査結果では、AIが人々の感情体験や幸福感にどのような影響を与えるのかを分析しており、AIに感情的な相談やアドバイスを求める人の感情はAIとやりとりすることでポジティブになる傾向があると示されました。続きを読む.

articles.title: Anthropic、AIの「感情的利用」調査結果を公開 対策も提示
articles.summary: Anthropicは、AI「Claude」の感情的な利用に関する調査結果を公開した。感情的な会話は全体の約3％と稀だが、内容は多岐にわたる。会話を通じてユーザーの感情が肯定的になる傾向が見られるが、AIを専門家の代替とはせず、安全対策を進める。.

articles.summary: After quietly pausing the rollout of Google Photos’ AI-powered “Ask Photos” search tool, Google is now expanding access once again and making some improvements to the feature. articles.summary: 20815v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: LLM-powered applications are highly susceptible to the quality of user prompts, and crafting high-quality prompts can often be challenging especially for domain-specific applications.

articles.title: Beyond Reactive Safety: Risk-Aware LLM Alignment via Long-Horizon Simulation
articles.summary: 20949v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Given the growing influence of language model-based agents on high-stakes societal decisions, from public policy to healthcare, ensuring their beneficial impact requires understanding the far-reaching implications of their suggestions.

articles.title: Unveiling Causal Reasoning in Large Language Models: Reality or Mirage?
articles.summary: 21215v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Causal reasoning capability is critical in advancing large language models (LLMs) toward strong artificial intelligence.

articles.title: IXAII: An Interactive Explainable Artificial Intelligence Interface for Decision Support Systems
articles.summary: 21310v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Although several post-hoc methods for explainable AI have been developed, most are static and neglect the user perspective, limiting their effectiveness for the target audience.

articles.title: TableMoE: Neuro-Symbolic Routing for Structured Expert Reasoning in Multimodal Table Understanding
articles.summary: 21393v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Multimodal understanding of tables in real-world contexts is challenging due to the complexity of structure, symbolic density, and visual degradation (blur, skew, watermarking, incomplete structures or fonts, multi-span or hierarchically nested layouts).

articles.title: Spatial Mental Modeling from Limited Views
articles.summary: 21458v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Can Vision Language Models (VLMs) imagine the full scene from just a few views, like humans do. Humans form spatial mental models, internal representations of unseen space, to reason about layout, perspective, and motion.

articles.title: Brain2Model Transfer: Training sensory and decision models with human neural activity as a teacher
articles.summary: 20834v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Transfer learning enhances the training of novel sensory and decision models by employing rich feature representations from large, pre-trained teacher models.

articles.title: Stochastic Quantum Spiking Neural Networks with Quantum Memory and Local Learning
articles.summary: 21324v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Neuromorphic and quantum computing have recently emerged as promising paradigms for advancing artificial intelligence, each offering complementary strengths.

articles.title: Efficient Event-based Delay Learning in Spiking Neural Networks
articles.summary: 07331v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Spiking Neural Networks (SNNs) compute using sparse communication and are attracting increased attention as a more energy-efficient alternative to traditional Artificial Neural Networks~(ANNs).

articles.title: Bridging the Gap Between Approximation and Learning via Optimal Approximation by ReLU MLPs of Maximal Regularity
articles.summary: 12335v4 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: The foundations of deep learning are supported by the seemingly opposing perspectives of approximation or learning theory.

articles.title: StereoDiff: Stereo-Diffusion Synergy for Video Depth Estimation
articles.summary: 20756v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent video depth estimation methods achieve great performance by following the paradigm of image depth estimation, i. , typically fine-tuning pre-trained video diffusion models with massive data.

articles.title: Vector Contrastive Learning For Pixel-Wise Pretraining In Medical Vision
articles.summary: 20850v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Contrastive learning (CL) has become a cornerstone of self-supervised pretraining (SSP) in foundation models, however, extending CL to pixel-wise representation, crucial for medical vision, remains an open problem.

articles.title: THIRDEYE: Cue-Aware Monocular Depth Estimation via Brain-Inspired Multi-Stage Fusion
articles.summary: 20877v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Monocular depth estimation methods traditionally train deep models to infer depth directly from RGB pixels.

articles.title: Towards Probabilistic Question Answering Over Tabular Data
articles.summary: 20747v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Current approaches for question answering (QA) over tabular data, such as NL2SQL systems, perform well for factual questions where answers are directly retrieved from tables.

articles.title: Multi-lingual Functional Evaluation for Large Language Models
articles.summary: 20793v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Multi-lingual competence in large language models is often evaluated via static data benchmarks such as Belebele, M-MMLU and M-GSM.

articles.title: Optimising Language Models for Downstream Tasks: A Post-Training Perspective
articles.summary: 20917v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Language models (LMs) have demonstrated remarkable capabilities in NLP, yet adapting them efficiently and robustly to specific tasks remains challenging.

articles.title: KaLM-Embedding-V2: Superior Training Techniques and Data Inspire A Versatile Embedding Model
articles.summary: 20923v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper, we propose KaLM-Embedding-V2, a versatile and compact embedding model, which achieves impressive performance in general-purpose text embedding tasks by leveraging superior training techniques and data.

articles.title: Can Gradient Descent Simulate Prompting?
articles.summary: 20989v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: There are two primary ways of incorporating new information into a language model (LM): changing its prompt or changing its parameters, e. Parameter updates incur no long-term storage cost for model changes.

articles.title: クリエイティブ・コモンズがAI対応の「CC Signals」発表、AIトレーニングへどう再利用可能か・不可かをコンテンツ所有者が詳細に指定できるフレームワーク
articles.summary: 著作者が「この条件を守れば私の作品を自由に使って構いません」と意思表示できるクリエイティブ・コモンズ・ライセンス(CCライセンス)を提供する国際的非営利組織のクリエイティブ・コモンズが、AI時代に対応した新しいフレームワークの「CC Signals」を発表しました。クリエイティブ・コモンズはCC Signalsについて、「共有利益を基盤としたより公平で持続可能なAIエコシステムの構築に向けた大きな一歩」と説明しています。続きを読む.

articles.title: Report: DeepSeek’s newest model delayed by GPU export restrictions
articles.summary: China’s top artificial intelligence company DeepSeek Ltd. has reportedly come unstuck in its efforts to develop its next-generation R2 reasoning model, because it cannot get its hands on enough of Nvidia Corp. ’s graphics processing units, according to a report.

articles.title: How open-source developers can meet global cybersecurity laws — before it’s too late
articles.summary: Standards, guidelines and laws govern the world. However, few places embody that reality better than the digital realm. With new and hybridized attack pathways proliferating rapidly, countries are updating their cybersecurity laws to keep pace.

articles.title: Chronosphere redefines cloud-native observability with Logs 2.0 and real-time data control
articles.summary: Cloud-native observability delivers deep, real-time visibility into complex, distributed systems — accelerating the detection, root cause analysis and resolution of issues across microservices, containers and serverless environments.

articles.title: Salesforce chief Marc Benioff says AI now does up to half of all the work at his company

articles.title: CoreWeave reportedly seeking to acquire data center operator Core Scientific

articles.title: Inside a plan to use AI to amplify doubts about the dangers of pollutants

articles.title: As Iran and Israel fought, people turned to AI for facts. They didn't find many

PadChest-GR, developed by the University of Alicante with Microsoft Research, has the potential to advance research across the field for years to come.
